title: Dance the Night Away (Twice song)
text:
"Dance the Night Away" is a song recorded by South Korean girl group <a href="Twice">Twice</a>. It was released by <a href="JYP%20Entertainment">JYP Entertainment</a> on July 9, 2018, as the lead single from the group's reissue of their fifth extended play, "<a href="Summer%20Nights%20%28EP%29">Summer Nights</a>".
Background and release.
Twice's new release was first revealed on June 7, 2018. On June 18, it was officially announced by <a href="JYP%20Entertainment">JYP Entertainment</a> that the group would make a comeback with a new single titled "Dance the Night Away". It is the title track of their album "<a href="Summer%20Nights%20%28EP%29">Summer Nights</a>". Both song and the album were released on July 9 on various music portals.
Composition.
"Dance the Night Away" was composed by several music producers and has lyrics written by <a href="Wheesung">Wheesung</a>. It was described as a "song that offers a fresh tune that suits the summer weather" and was meant to showcase the group's youthfulness. It is a vivacious <a href="electronic%20dance%20music">electronic dance music</a> track with an upbeat tempo.
Tamar Herman from <a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">"Billboard"</a> described the song as a "summery EDM and <a href="groove%20%28music%29">groovy</a> <a href="pop%20music">pop</a> track that bounces around over a beat of thumping bass, bright horns, and blaring synths."
Music video.
The music video of "Dance the Night Away" was filmed on an <a href="Okinawa%20Prefecture">Okinawa</a> beach in early June 2018. Two video teasers were first released on July 1 and 5. The full music video was uploaded online on July 9. It features the nine members of Twice as castaways who wash up on a beach.
Two months after its release, the music video recorded 100 million views on <a href="YouTube">YouTube</a>. It also ranked seventh on the 2018 YouTube Rewind list in the category for the 10 Most Popular Music Videos in South Korea.
Promotion.
A few hours after the release of the song, Twice held a live broadcast on <a href="Naver">Naver V Live</a> to commemorate their comeback, where they also performed the full choreography of the song for the first time. The group also performed "Dance the Night Away" for their comeback stages on "<a href="Music%20Bank%20%28TV%20series%29">Music Bank</a>", "<a href="Show%21%20Music%20Core">Show! Music Core</a>", "<a href="Inkigayo">Inkigayo</a>", "<a href="Show%20Champion">Show Champion</a>" and "<a href="M%20Countdown">M Countdown</a>" on July 13, 14, 15, 18 and 19, respectively.
Japanese version.
Twice's second compilation album "<a href="Twice2">#Twice2</a>", released on March 6, 2019, includes both Korean and Japanese versions of the song. The Japanese lyrics were written by Eri Osanai.
Commercial performance.
The song debuted atop <a href="Gaon%20Music%20Chart">"Gaon"</a>'s <a href="Gaon%20Digital%20Chart">Digital Chart</a> and "Billboard Korea"'s <a href="Kpop%20Hot%20100">Kpop Hot 100</a>. It also peaked at No. 2, 5 and 11 on <a href="Billboard%20charts">"Billboard" charts</a>' <a href="World%20Digital%20Song%20Sales">World Digital Song Sales</a>, <a href="Billboard%20Japan%20Hot%20100">"Billboard Japan" Hot 100</a> and <a href="Oricon">Oricon Digital Singles</a>, respectively.
In 2019, "Dance the Night Away" surpassed 100 million streams in March and 2,500,000 downloads in September on Gaon Music Chart, earning group's very first <a href="Gaon%20Music%20Chart%23Certification">Platinum certification</a>'s single both streaming and download from the <a href="Gaon%20Music%20Chart">Korea Music Content Association</a> (KMCA) since certification were introduced in April 2018.
